---
slug: /167
title: "This Week In React #167: Aria Components, Hydration, Remix, Server Components, useSyncExternalStore, cache, perf, Glow, Unistyles, Expo, :has(), Tailwind, date-fns..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 12-19-2023
---
Hi everyone!
Once again this week, we have a good mix of articles and releases.

segments.source_content: Learn React.js from the ground up to advanced topics like performance, testing, and code quality. Start by building a real-world app in the Complete Introduction to React. Continue with Intermediate React, integrating the most popular tools from the ecosystem. Then learn performance, TypeScript, and even Next.js, the fullstack React framework!

translations.fr: Apprenez React.js depuis les bases jusqu'aux sujets avanc√©s comme les performances, les tests et la qualit√© du code. Commencez par construire une application r√©elle dans l'Introduction Compl√®te √† React. Poursuivez avec React Interm√©diaire, int√©grant les outils les plus populaires de l'√©cosyst√®me. Puis apprenez les performances, TypeScript, et m√™me Next.js, le framework React fullstack !
translations.en: Apprenez React.js depuis les bases jusqu'aux sujets avanc√©s comme les performances, les tests et la qualit√© du code. Commencez par construire une application du monde r√©el dans l'Introduction Compl√®te √† React. Continuez avec React Interm√©diaire, en int√©grant les outils les plus populaires de l'√©cosyst√®me. Puis apprenez les performances, TypeScript, et m√™me Next.js, le framework React fullstack !

segments.source_content: ## ‚öõÔ∏è React {#react}
[![**React Aria Components 1.0**](/emails/issues/167/reactaria.jpg)](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2023-12-20.html)
[**React Aria Components 1.0**](https://react-spectrum.adobe.com/releases/2023-12-20.html)

Devon just üê¶ [announced](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1737516074663362843) the stable release of React Aria Components 1.0. Over 40 components with built-in behavior, adaptive interactions, top-tier accessibility, and internationalization out of the box, ready for your styles.

translations.fr: Devon vient de üê¶ [annoncer](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1737516074663362843) la version stable de React Aria Components 1.0. Plus de 40 composants avec comportement int√©gr√©, interactions adaptatives, accessibilit√© de premier ordre et internationalisation pr√™ts √† l'emploi, pr√™ts pour vos styles.
translations.en: Devon vient de üê¶ [annoncer](https://twitter.com/devongovett/status/1737516074663362843) la version stable de React Aria Components 1.0. Plus de 40 composants avec comportement int√©gr√©, interactions adaptatives, accessibilit√© de premier ordre et internationalisation pr√™ts √† l'emploi, pr√™ts pour vos styles.

segments.source_content: [![**React Hydration Overlay**](/emails/issues/167/hydration.jpg)](https://www.builder.io/blog/announcing-react-hydration-overlay)
[**React Hydration Overlay - Easily Squash Hydration Errors**](https://www.builder.io/blog/announcing-react-hydration-overlay)

A brand-new project that permits to add a handy error overlay to help debugging hydration errors. For now, this can be added to Next.js sites thanks to a Webpack plugin, but this is a much-needed feature that we all hope to see land in React core.

translations.fr: Un tout nouveau projet qui permet d'ajouter un overlay d'erreur pratique pour aider au d√©bogage des erreurs d'hydratation. Pour l'instant, cela peut √™tre ajout√© aux sites Next.js gr√¢ce √† un plugin Webpack, mais c'est une fonctionnalit√© tr√®s attendue que nous esp√©rons tous voir int√©gr√©e au c≈ìur de React.
translations.en: Un tout nouveau projet permettant d'ajouter une superposition d'erreurs pratique pour d√©boguer les erreurs d'hydratation. Pour l'instant, cela peut √™tre ajout√© aux sites Next.js via un plugin Webpack, mais c'est une fonctionnalit√© tr√®s attendue que nous esp√©rons tous voir int√©gr√©e dans le c≈ìur de React.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Take the Developer Nation Survey - A virtual goody bag packed with free data, promo codes for event tickets, courses, tools & platforms is waiting at the end of the survey!](https://developereconomics.net/?member_id=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=nl_ad3)
- üëÄ [Remix PR - unstable_serverBundles - split your route tree](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/pull/8332)
- üìñ [React Docs Update](https://github.com/reactwg/server-components/discussions/7): an overview of all the new official docs pages that were recently published on React.dev, including `use`, `cache`, `form` and many other experimental/canary APIs. There's even a "Coming Soon" section referencing docs for new [static resource preloading APIs](https://github.com/reactjs/react.dev/pull/6459).
- üìñ [Updated Next.js testing docs - using App Router and TypeScript](https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/testing)
- üìú [Concurrent React, External Stores, and Tearing](https://interbolt.org/blog/react-ui-tearing/): An advanced article explaining how React can end up displaying an inconsistent UI (tearing). `useSyncExternalStore` helps to render a consistent UI, but it can also de-optimize your React transitions. See also the [Tearable Dots interactive demo](https://tearabledots.com/).
- üìú [Explaining React's cache Function](https://unicorn-utterances.com/posts/explaining-reacts-cache-function): interactive article presenting the experimental React API, and how it differs from `useMemo`. It permits cross-component caching and can be used to preload data.
- üìú [How to Get Rid of ‚ÄúWindow is Not Defined‚Äù and Hydration Mismatch Errors in Next.js](https://medium.com/@eric.burel/how-to-get-rid-of-window-is-not-defined-and-hydration-mismatch-errors-in-next-js-567cc51b4a17): Shares 5 tips to avoid React hydration problems.
- üìú [React Tricks: Fast, Fit and Fun](https://molefrog.com/notes/react-tricks): React perf lessons learned from building Wouter, a React router.
- üìú [Netlify‚Äôs Disingenuous Survey-based Attack on Next.js (and Eleventy, too)](https://www.zachleat.com/web/netlify-and-nextjs/): Eleventy creator's criticism of how Netlify presented their State of Web Dev survey results.
- üìú [Upcoming React and React-Native Conferences for 2024](https://thoughtbot.com/blog/upcoming-react-and-react-native-conferences-for-2024)
- üìú [What is Reactivity?](https://unicorn-utterances.com/posts/what-is-reactivity)
- üìú [What are React Server Actions?](https://unicorn-utterances.com/posts/what-are-react-server-actions)
- üìú [What is React Suspense and Async Rendering?](https://unicorn-utterances.com/posts/what-is-react-suspense-and-async-rendering)
- üìú [The Complete Guide To React Suspense](https://www.debugbear.com/blog/guide-to-react-suspense)
- üìú [Migrating from Jest to Vitest for your React Application](https://dev.to/opensauced/migrating-from-jest-to-vitest-for-your-react-application-1b75)
- üìú [Access the Search Params of a Request in Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/access-the-search-params-of-a-request-in-remix)
- üì¶ [Remix 2.4.0 with client data](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v240): The first Remix release to land their Client Data RFC, which allows querying data APIs directly from the client (skipping the server).
- üì¶ [React-Glow - Mouse-tracing glow effect](https://github.com/codaworks/react-glow)
- üì¶ [next-export-i18n 3.0 - App Router support](https://github.com/martinkr/next-export-i18n)
- üé• [Ben Holmes - React server components from scratch](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MaebEqhZR84): a great video showing how to implement a full RSC setup from scratch, including streaming, bundling, component routing, handling SSR, resolving client references...

- üìú [Acc√©der aux param√®tres de recherche d'une requ√™te dans Remix](https://sergiodxa.com/tutorials/access-the-search-params-of-a-request-in-remix)
- üì¶ [Remix 2.4.0 avec donn√©es client](https://github.com/remix-run/remix/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v240) : Premi√®re version impl√©mentant le RFC Client Data, permettant d'interroger des APIs directement depuis le client.
- üì¶ [React-Glow - Effet de lueur suivant la souris](https://github.com/codaworks/react-glow)

segments.source_content: All our content is **Project-Based-Learning** - which means that you will be learning the **skills** and adding **projects** to your portfolio at the same time!

segments.source_content: ## üì± React-Native {#react-native}
[![Unistyles 2.0](/emails/issues/167/unistyles20.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/@notjustdev/live?sub_confirmation=1)
[**Welcome to Unistyles 2.0!**](https://www.reactnativecrossroads.com/posts/unistyles-2-preview)

Unistyles is a cross-platform styling library. It is built as a superset of StyleSheet (if you use React Native, you‚Äôre probably familiar with StyleSheet.create ‚Ä¶) similar to how TypeScript is a superset of JavaScript. First released just three months ago, it has since gained over 500 stars on GitHub and is now approaching its second major version with enhanced TypeScript types, no dependence on React Context anymore, and fresh C++ bindings to boost performance. A very interesting new feature is the addition of plugin support, which could enable some interesting new use cases.

translations.en: Unistyles est une biblioth√®que de styles multiplateforme. Elle est con√ßue comme un sur-ensemble de StyleSheet (si vous utilisez React Native, vous connaissez probablement StyleSheet.create...) similaire √† la fa√ßon dont TypeScript est un sur-ensemble de JavaScript. Publi√©e il y a seulement trois mois, elle a d√©j√† gagn√© plus de 500 √©toiles sur GitHub et s'appr√™te √† sortir sa deuxi√®me version majeure avec des types TypeScript am√©lior√©s, plus aucune d√©pendance √† React Context, et de nouvelles liaisons C++ pour am√©liorer les performances. Une nouvelle fonctionnalit√© tr√®s int√©ressante est l'ajout de la prise en charge des plugins, qui pourrait permettre de nouveaux cas d'utilisation passionnants.

fr.translation: Unistyles est une biblioth√®que de styles multiplateforme con√ßue comme un sur-ensemble de StyleSheet (famili√®re aux utilisateurs de React Native via `StyleSheet.create`), √† l'instar de TypeScript pour JavaScript. Lanc√©e il y a trois mois, elle compte d√©j√† plus de 500 stars sur GitHub et pr√©pare sa deuxi√®me version majeure avec : des types TypeScript am√©lior√©s, l'abandon de la d√©pendance √† React Context, et des liaisons C++ pour optimiser les performances. Le support de plugins, nouvelle fonctionnalit√© prometteuse, ouvre des cas d'utilisation innovants.
fr.reason: The number of special elements (links, code, variables) differs. Source has 0, translation has 1.

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [AnimateReactNative - Premium and Custom React Native animations](https://www.animatereactnative.com/?utm_source=thisweekinreact.com)
- üê¶ [Evan Bacon - "Expo Router v3 now has full support for popular web libraries like Radix, Tailwind, Shadcn UI, etc.](https://twitter.com/Baconbrix/status/1735011941431595149)
- üìñ [Expo Guide on How to use the New Architecture](https://docs.expo.dev/guides/new-architecture/): All `expo-*` packages except expo-updates support the new architecture. Support for `expo-updates` is planned for Expo SDK 51.
- üìú [Expo 2023 - The year in review](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/12-20-2023-year-in-review): An overview of everything Expo launched this year, including Expo Orbit, Expo Router, EAS improvements, 3 SDKs, Expo Modules API and much more.
- üìú [Xcode 15.1 image is now available on EAS Build](https://expo.dev/changelog/2023/12-19-eas-build-xcode-15.1-image): Xcode 15.1 primarily fixes bugs.
- üìú [Optimizing Performance in React-Native: Tips and Techniques](https://thoughtbot.com/blog/optimizing-performance-in-react-native-tips-and-techniques): Tutorial on how to apply memoization, use virtualized lists, optimize images, debounce, optimize bundle size and network requests
- üìú [Building AR face masks in React Native](https://blog.logrocket.com/building-ar-face-masks-react-native/): How to load and apply 3D face masks using DeepAR
- üìú [Introducing docs.infinite.red ‚Äî A New Home for Infinite Red‚Äôs Documentation - Ignite, Reactotron, RN MLKit, Gluegun](https://shift.infinite.red/introducing-docs-infinite-red-a-new-home-for-infinite-reds-documentation-6f4b25f7a1a4)
- üìú [Universal Medusa: The why, when and how of universal e-commerce apps with Medusa.js, Expo and Next.js](https://bidah.hashnode.dev/universal-medusa-the-why-when-and-how-of-universal-e-commerce-apps-with-medusajs-expo-and-nextjs)
- üì¶ [React Native 0.73.1 is out](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.73.1): Adds `enableNetworkInspector` to enable Network panel and CDP handlers in inspector proxy, bumps CLI to 12.3.0
- üì¶ [React Native Windows 0.73.1 is out](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/releases/tag/react-native-windows_v0.73.1): Brings React Native 0.73 to Windows
- üì¶ [Repack 3.7 - 0.73 compat](https://github.com/callstack/repack/releases/tag/%40callstack%2Frepack%403.7.0)
- üé• [Ignite 9 video overview by Jamon Holmgren](https://youtu.be/QmkMsUYrTlk?si=p9rvLM-EMggZNcft)
- üéôÔ∏è [Rocket Ship #021 - The React Native IDE with Krzysztof Magiera](https://podcast.galaxies.dev/episodes/021-the-react-native-ide-with-krzysztof-magiera)
